Go Newsletter
Issue 63 — June 18, 2015
A LETTER FROM THE EDITORS

First, I wish to apologize for sending this issue twice today. Do not adjust your set - this is deliberate :-)

The reason is a certain link in the original email triggered Gmail's phishing detector and prevented many of you enjoying the newsletter. I've figured out that Gmail erroneously thinks domains containing hex numbers are hex IP URLs, even if they're just regular domains..

Thanks for your patience! And any questions, hit me up on Twitter at @peterc, especially if you work at Gmail and want to fix the bug ;-)

- Peter Cooper

Featured
Practical Cryptography With Go
A book that you can buy or read for free online here that presents an introduction to cryptography for developers and gives some practical use cases in Go.
Kyle Isom
Where to Define Command-Line Flags in Go
If you build a command-line tool in Go, you’ll need to work out where to define and accept arguments as flags. Bernard looks at a simple approach.
Bernerd Schaefer
Learning Go with Flashcards and Spaced Repetition
A look at an interesting way to learn Go.
Nicola Paolucci
Why Go Is Doomed to Succeed   opinion 
“[Go thrives] in projects built by large groups of programmers with different skill levels, and there is no larger such group than the open source community.” Much discussion about this was had on Reddit.
